Opgaven er manuel test af valutahandelssystem. Start: Snarest muligt Varighed: 6 måneder Arbejdssted: København Krav: Min. fem års professionel IT-erhvervserfaring. Tip en ven Udskriv Interesseret i lignende opgaver? Tilmeld dig på vores CV-site. Når vi modtager en
ny opgave, som passer til dine kompetencer, kontakter vi dig
direkte. For at tilmelde dig behøver du kun at indtaste
dine kontaktdata og uploade dit CV. Tilmeld dig Jeg er interesseret i denne opgave Jeg opfylder kompetencekravet til denne opgave: Jeg har minimum fem års professionel IT-erhvervserfaring, og jeg er interesseret i at arbejde som freelancekonsulent. Navn: Feltet skal udfyldes. Mobil: Feltet skal udfyldes. E-mail: Feltet skal udfyldes. Indtast venligst en gyldig e-mail. CV: Mit CV er registreret på CV-siten. Jeg er ikke registreret – se vedhæftede CV. Vedhæftet: Intet er blevet vedhæftet. JavaScript er påkrævet for at kunne vedhæfte filer. Slå venligst JavaScript til. Frivilligprofilen Mød de frivillige Virtual volunteering Spørgsmål & svar Frivillig i udlandet Dagpenge og efterløn Din FrivilligProfil Find job WAFA is looking for a Web Editor The Humanitarian Water Air and Food Award is looking for a Web Editor Humanitarian Water and Food Award Spergelmarken 10 2860 Søborg 24.01.2016 23.04.2016 Contact organisation The Humanitarian Water, Air and Food Award needs a Web Editor Do you want to have fun making a difference? Do you want to be part of a global mission? Do you want to work with a volunteer team of committed professionals? Your profile: Excellent communication skills Good level of written and spoken English Other languages are an asset Experience with Word Press Team player with the 'can do' attitude Your role will include the following: You get to co-create a website to make us proud! Interacting with area managers to get ideas and stories; Collecting and editing texts, photos and videos; Creating a compelling web platform; Working with Word Press Your team includes our graphic designer and a webmaster. You will work from home, communicating through Skype and other online platforms.Your hours will be flexible and subject to mutual agreement. Sounds interesting? Read on! You can bring a lot to our team, like ... Commitment to sustainability; English-language journalism skills; Strategic website communication; Social media integration; Familiarity with different web platforms; Team-playing across time zones; You will need your own computer with internet access and phone. About us. The Humanitarian Water, Air and Food Award (WAFA) is a global non-profit organization, founded in 2008 and headquartered in Denmark. Our vision is clean water and healthy food for all. Our mission is to raise awareness of global challenges and support sustainable breakthroughs. To accomplish this, we promote pioneering initiatives around the world with annual awards and cash grants. Our CSR platform also brings together companies, knowledge institutions, social entrepreneurs and committed individuals. WAF volunteers combine their talents, strengths and passion to make a difference. The mission is noble, the work is fun, and the growth is real. Join us! Follow the application instructions on this page and don't forget to include your CV. Looking forward to hearing from you! Notice: This is unpaid volunteer work. FrivilligJob.dk is Denmark's leading volunteer job portal. Contact organisation vis alle job hos organisationen × Ansøg job Vent venligst, henter ansøgningsskema... Job type IT Communication & PR Work area Humanitary work Geographical area Gladsaxe Kommune FRIVILLIGJOB.DK FREDERIKSGADE 78B, 1, 8000 AARHUS C.

Title: Audio Software Technical Lead, ICEpower
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text:
Lignende jobannoncer Job i Storkøbenhavn kategoriseret i Systemudvikling og programmering (234) Job i Nordsjælland kategoriseret i Systemudvikling og programmering (42) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-25 04:09:20. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-25 04:09:20. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Audio Software Technical Lead, ICEpower ICEPOWER A/S - Kongens Lyngby Do you have strong software development skills, a flair for communicating with customers and are you ready to take the next step in your career? Would you like the opportunity to: •use your broad technical expertise to manage a small Software Developer team and work with some of the largest global companies in the PC and tablet industry? •be a key contributor to the continued success of ICEpower? •work in a small, dynamic and agile organisation with a flat hierarchy, fast decisions and where your contributions and results have a direct and visible impact on the success of the company? Help develop the sound of the future – join ICEpower ICEpower was founded in 1999 and is fully owned by Bang & Olufsen. Based in Kgs. Lyngby near Copenhagen, we develop and manufacture high performance Class D audio solutions for consumer, professional, automotive and mobile audio applications. ICEpower has developed an audio software package, ICEsound, which is an audio processing solution for improving the audio quality of Windows and Android products, such as laptops, tablets and smartphones. Our products are developed in Denmark and we have a technical on-site support team in Taiwan. Ensure ongoing progress and lead day-to-day operations As Technical Lead, you take on the overall responsibility for managing the ICEsound products, ensuring the continued development of the software solutions and the technical support towards the customers. In doing so, you are actively involved in the software development and you also manage the team in Denmark and Taiwan consisting of 3 colleagues. Furthermore, you ensure through our team in Taiwan that we proactively solve integration issues to avoid delays to the customers’ mass production schedules. This includes both day-to-day bug fixing, trouble shooting and staying on top of technology changes such as new versions of Android, Windows and hardware platforms. Moreover, you ensure good lines of communication between the customer and ICEpower. Regular trips to visit our customers in Asia should be expected. Lastly, you develop and maintain our technology roadmap, so we constantly innovate our core audio technologies and improve the performance of our solution. The ideal mix between people skills and solid technical expertise •You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Software Engineering or other appropriate engineering degree combined with a keen interest in software design. •You are a skilled software developer with experience in low level Android architecture and keep this knowledge up to date. •Maybe you have knowledge about and experience with real time audio processing software. •You have worked closely with business customers previously and know what it takes to make sure that they feel at ease and taken care of. •Ideally, you possess both hardcore Android/Windows low level development experience and knowledge about real time audio processing. As a person, you are outgoing and while mastering the technical aspect of the job, you also possess great people skills. It is vital that you have an interest in stepping up and leading a global team and that you communicate effortlessly in English. Additional information & application For additional information about the position, please contact Head of Sales & Marketing, Mads Emil Hansen Solgaard, on +45 96 84 57 54. Applications are continuously assessed, so please, send your application as soon as possible. Ledige stillinger:

Title: Technical Consultant
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job i Storkøbenhavn kategoriseret i Systemudvikling og programmering (234) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-28 07:01:39. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-28 07:01:39. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Technical Consultant LogPoint - København SIEM is the fastest growing market within IT security worldwide. At LogPoint we are experiencing this growth and our ambitious goal of becoming the best SIEM solution on the market only fuels this. We are continuously expanding and are currently in search of a new enthusiastic colleague. We need a responsible and flexible person, who is inspired by complex and advanced technology, want to work in a team-oriented environment and is no stranger to a challenge. Your tasks and responsibilities will include: Advanced pre-sales support for the sales team Architectural design of LogPoint enterprise solutions for end-customers and partners Configuration and customization of solutions in cooperation with customers and partners Training customers and partners in using LogPoint Installation of the LogPoint solution Technical support for customers and partners Providing market feedback to our product development to enhance the future of the product Requirements: Technical qualifications: The ideal candidate is expected to have a higher education within the technical field, but there are several approaches to this position and relevant experience is key. The right candidate may have a background and several years of experience at the system- or network administrator level in a large enterprise business with responsibility for part of the infrastructure. In addition, the ideal candidate has expert knowledge of one or more of the following: Microsoft Windows server infrastructure Network and firewalls Linux Enterprise applications (Databases, Mail platforms, etc.) Cybersecurity and general IT security knowledge is a requirement Knowledge of script and programming languages such as Python, Java or Powershell is an advantage, but not a requirement. Personal qualifications: As you will be responsible for teaching LogPoint to customers and partners, it is imperative that you speak English at a business level and are not intimidated by public speaking. You focus on the customer and the issues they are experiencing and you know how to adapt to different types of customers. You are responsible, have good situational awareness and are able to cooperate both internally and externally. You are used to working independently and plan your tasks. You work is structured, with a sense of quality and you are focused on your tasks. You are able to assess and analyze a problem and act on it. You are not afraid to ask others for advice to ensure you find the best solution. You feel joy in learning new things – you are quick to acquire new knowledge and not afraid to move into new areas. You also have a good sense of your own restraints. Benefits: We offer: You will be part of an international team of competent colleagues. You will receive a compensation package that matches your skills and will become part of an inspiring environment, which will help you develop your skills and competencies. We work in an informal and relaxed manner. Contact: You can read more about LogPoint on our website www.logpoint.com. You are also welcome to contact Vice President, Presale and Support, Christian Osbahr on +45 2112 7049 to learn more about the position. Application: Please upload your CV and cover letter. Applicants are evaluated on a continuous basis, until we find the right match. Note: Candidates must be either EU citizens or currently possess a work visa, which entitles the holder to take up full time employment in Denmark. 3 dage siden - gem job - oprindeligt job » Ansøg nu Gennemlæs venligst alle ansøgningsinstruktionerne før du ansøger til LogPoint. Title: FrontEnd Architect
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text:
Lignende jobannoncer Job i Storkøbenhavn kategoriseret i Systemudvikling og programmering (234) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-28 07:07:41. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-28 07:07:41. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område FrontEnd Architect MOVIESTARPLANET ApS - København Do you thrive in helping others see the big picture? In communicating and collaborating with skilled developers, making the technically complex seem simple? As FrontEnd Architect at MovieStarPlanet you will: •Develop, maintain and communicate the vision for the client side architecture in close collaboration with each of our cross-disciplinary teams •Spearhead the visualization of the architecture, making it easy to understand for all developers •Assist our cross-disciplinary teams on a daily basis to develop and maintain their own technical and architectural visions, sparring with experienced seniors and assisting and mentoring talented juniors •Produce high-level architectural concepts for new features and provide rough estimates for their development About the Job Develop technical goals and visions At MovieStarPlanet we use one of the leading cross-platform technologies for Mobile Game Development, Adobe AIR, to develop our games on iOS, Android and Kindle. Our games are highly interactive, social and creative and offer many forms of entertainment, such as customizable, animated avatars, mini-games and home-made videos. We strive to continuously develop our games to be the best, with new, fun and engaging features for our kids. The MovieStarPlanet game is developed on 4 different cross-disciplinary teams. Your main task will be to help the programmers on those teams develop the game architecture. To help them see the technical goals beyond their individual tasks, while also allowing for their independence and autonomy. Collaborating with the Lead Programmer and Team Leads, you will help your peers master the Agile balance of iterative development versus maintaining an overall technical vision and big picture. We believe that all Architects must also be coders, so you will use around half your time coding in AS3, creating and improving shared structures to improve the core architecture and performance of our clients. You will not be expected to know the details of every nook and crook of our systems, but to bring together the specialists you work with, utilizing the strengths of each to the fullest. As FrontEnd Architect you report to the Lead Programmer. About You •You hold a M.Sc. in Computer Science or similar degree within software development •At least 8 years of development experience •At least 3 years of experience of Object Oriented designing and development •At least 3 years of experience with either AS3, Java or C# •Expert knowledge of Design Patterns •Thorough understanding of memory management and optimization techniques •Experience collaborating in a SCRUM environment with minimal supervision •You have excellent communication skills •Your English skills are excellent - verbally and in writing The following would also be a plus: •Experience with test-driven development •Applied knowledge of Network monitoring tools You are highly self-motivated and enthusiastic, both when it comes to solving complex problems, learning about new technology, building the best solution and communicating your ideas. At the same time, you really like working with other skilled developers, exchanging ideas with seniors and mentoring juniors, always respecting the viewpoint of others. You can foresee and identify issues, both local and across platforms, and can collaborate in working out their solutions. You always strive for the best quality, and take personal pride in developing a stable client with zero tolerance for errors. You have a knack for explaining complex concepts in a simple way and can communicate smoothly across departments. Agile is your absolute preferred way of life and you favor direct communication, over checkboxes. At the same time, you will never execute a tedious task twice if you can build a script to do it. You have a strong sense of responsibility towards your team, and will always do your utmost to help a team mate dealing with a tricky problem. About Us MovieStarPlanet ApS is the company behind MovieStarPlanet.com, BooniePlanet.com and RoboBlastPlanet.com - games and social networks for tweens aged 8-15 years. In virtual worlds each user designs their own MovieStar avatar, Robot or Boonie, which can be used for creating small animated movies. They can also chat, design looks, scrapbooks and clothes, and play mini games with other users. Launched in Denmark in 2009, MovieStarPlanet has since experienced explosive growth. Currently the website is live in 11 European markets as well as the United States, Canada, Australia and New Zealand. Globally it ranks among the most popular virtual worlds for the target group with more than 200 million registered profiles. MovieStarPlanet ApS employs +100 staff and the Head Office is based in the attractive surroundings of the new and modern part of Copenhagen called Ørestad, located very close to the city center and the metro line. Why work with Us? Touch the lives of millions of kids every day. You will get to be part of a fast growing company, producing one of the most popular games/social networks in the world for tweens. Your colleagues are highly qualified, creative and innovative people. We are very ambitious and strive to develop and support the most talked about and played game/social network in the world! We believe in learning by doing and taking ownership of tasks and projects. Besides being a challenging and inspiring place to work, we value having a casual and fun work environment where ideas can flourish. We have employees from all corners of the globe, which provides a vibrant and eclectic atmosphere. The corporate language is English. How to Apply Please apply for this position online by clicking the "Apply for this position" button. Your application should contain the following: •A cover letter – including a short description of your educational background, working experience and why you are motivated to work at MovieStarPlanet •Your CV and exam results Application deadline is as soon as possible. We will be holding interviews at the earliest convenience. Ledige stillinger:

Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område SAP Retail Solution Architect MRP Global - København SAP Retail Solution Architect required to deliver a global SAP Retail implementation. Great opportunity for career development, chance to build and deploy a global SAP Retail solution - IS-Retail HANA, CAR. Based from the clients Copenhagen HQ. Long term contract, multi-year programme, excellent daily rates. Deliverables of the SAP Retail Solution Architect; Design and deployment of a large scale global SAP IS-Retail solution – HANA / CAR Review functional specifications for design Produce high level design and documentation Lead a team of SAP Retail Consultants Responsible for overseeing overall solution Architecture across global design of IS Retail Roll out the solution to Europe & globally Perform quality assurance for project deliverables Go live support and hypercare Key Criteria for the SAP Retail Solution Architect; Minimum 5 years’ SAP Retail experience Proven experience SAP Retail solutions and deploying across Europe or globally In-depth process knowledge – SAP HANA, CAR, IS-Retail Stakeholder management skills Hands on mentality – the ability to still configure SAP solutions Experience working with a managing consultants for SAP Retail, FMS, PMR, HANA, CAR, EWM If you are interested in this SAP Retail Solution Architect opportunity please apply. SAP RETAIL, SAP FMS, SD, MM, FMS, PMR, BI, P2P, eWM, CRM, HANA, CAR, Solution Architect, Team Lead, Senior Consultant, Project Manager, Fashion, Retail, Luxury Fashion, UK, Ireland, France, Italy, Germany, Spain, Portugal, Holland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Poland, Austria, Belgium, Croatia, Czech Republic, Greece, Hungary Dice - 5 dage siden - gem job » Vis eller anvend på job Send en e-mail til en ven med dette job SAP Retail Solution Architect Job i København Job på MRP Global i København Gennemse job - Om Indeed - Hjælpecenter Cookies hjælper os med at levere vores tjenester. Jobindex 20.600 job i 13.744 jobannoncer Log ind ...eller tilmeld dig her | English Menu Jobsøgere Søg job Din side Jobagenter CV Online ansøgning Søg virksomhed Test dig selv Tjek din løn Persontypetest Jobglæde Stresstest Råd og inspiration Gode råd om jobsøgning Ansøgningsmaskinen Jobvejleder Jobindex TV Jobindex Kurser Great Place to Work Karriereveje Elevplads Graduate program Eksportjob Vikar TopKvinder For virksomheder × Luk Følg virksomheder som du vil være en del af Når du følger virksomheden så vil du modtage relevant information fra virksomheden angående job i virksomheden. Virksomheden kan se dine personlige data som navn, adresse mm. Derved er du synlig når virksomheden skal rekruttere nye medarbejdere. Spørg mig ikke igen Luk Følg virksomheden IT Support position - Are you looking for a job in Technical Support? The Human Touch Are you looking for a job in Technical Support? Do speak Fluent Danish and have a good level of English? Do you know your way around Technology & would enjoy working in a team where you help others with their technical problems? If Yes keep reading because we are looking for a Danish speaker who wants to work in Belfast and earn £15,500 gross per year. What will you do in this job? As the Danish Technical support agent you will be responsible for handling all incoming calls and emails from our client's customers who have IT problems in relation to hardware devices and other software programs. You will be helping customers with any questions they may have and you will help them resolve their issues both efficiently and effectively. Lastly we are looking for someone who will strive to deliver an excellent customer experience with our clients IT department. Who will you be working for? Our client is a multilingual consulting and customer service solutions provider, over 30 years old and operating in a number of countries worldwide. Today they are currently looking for a Danish speaker to join their Technical Support Team in Belfast, Ireland. Who are we looking for? In order to apply for this Danish speaking Technical Support Job we are looking for you to have previous experience in a Danish speaking technical role. You speak fluent Danish and have a good level of English and you have excellent communication skills in both languages as you will be working over the phone and via email. Lastly we are looking for someone who can keep up to date with evolving nature of technology and that you enjoy working with IT Where would you be working? You will get to work in the capital of Northern Ireland, a.k.a. Belfast, the ideal location for someone looking for a change and a fresh start. You will be working in the heart of a culturally rich city with amazing architecture and a lot of history attached to it. Belfast offers easy access to public transport that will get you around town and all over Ireland, what's great is its only 2 hours away from Dublin by train. But wait it doesn't stop there, Belfast has a great night life to offer in regards to pubs, clubs & bars, and when you have had enough of the party life Belfast also has beautiful escapes to the countryside so you have it all here in Belfast. Interview & Salary The interview process for this Danish Technical Support Job will start with a phone screening, followed by second round interviews. If you are successful you can earn £15,500 gross per annum & don't forget there is a great relocation package on offer for the successful candidate. If you are interested in joining the technical support department in Belfast, don't hesitate, register with us today and Upload your CV in English. Don't Forget To Apply. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Ruby on Rails Developer - Copenhagen Vivino - København Vivino is seeking an experienced Ruby On Rails developer for our Copenhagen office, ready to join a vibrant start-up, building the world's #1 wine app and website. You'll join our existing Web-team to develop our web based client and public website. Your weapon of choice will be Ruby on Rails, working with a team with frontend HTML, CSS 3 and Javascript skills, as well as dedicated Backend and Design teams. Your tasks Develop our public website and other customer- and partner-facing platforms. Develop system-integrations with international E-commerce Partners driving wine sale across the world. Work with the Web team for frontend html, css and Javascript tasks, implementing responsive designs, to make the solution shine on laptops as well as tablets. Work with the Backend Team to create the APIs that powers the application. Work with the Design Team to accentuate the strengths of a web based solution, and ensure that these are carried over to the design and UX. Your profile You consider yourself an experienced web developer and are deeply familiar with the Ruby on Rails web framework. You excel at making the end-user experience fast, smooth and elegant. You're familiar with Test Driven Development. You are a curious, communicative person who is eager to learn. You are ready to join a startup with few formal procedures and limits. You're not an asshole. About Vivino Vivino is the world's largest wine community, built on top of a vast database of 7 million wines, 30 million ratings and 9 million wine reviews. More than 12 million users of the Vivino app provide ratings, reviews, price info and much more on a daily basis. Our app is by far the most downloaded and used wine app in the world and available in the Apple App Store, Google Play and Windows Marketplace. Vivino is Editors Choice on Android, and has had several frontpage features on the Apple App Store. Vivino is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, with offices in San Francisco, Ukraine and India. Contact Theis SÃ¸ndergaard theis@vivino.com Mark you application âRuby on Rails Developer" VentureLoop: Connect with Startups. Get in the Loop.
